Class Colony

  • java.lang.Object
    • Colony
  • public class Colony
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a colony of houses.
    Version:
    September 3, 2018
    Author:
    Aviral Agrawal, Shubhi Jain, Sarthak Moorjani

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private House[] houses
      This is an array of houses.
      private int numberOfHouses
      This maintains the current number of houses in the colony.

      Constructor for objects of class Colony.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      boolean addHouse​(House house)
      Adds house to the colony if number of houses in the colony are less than 10.
      int getNumberOfHouses()
      Returns the number of houses in the colony.
      int getRevenue()
      In this method you have to calculate the revenue that is generated by the colony.
      int goodWalls()
      For each house in the colony, you need to find the total number of good walls in it and then return the sum of the number of good walls for every house.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Field Detail

      • houses

        private House[] houses
        This is an array of houses. In a colony we can have a maximum of 10 houses. It is initialized in the constructor.

      • numberOfHouses

        private int numberOfHouses
        This maintains the current number of houses in the colony.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Colony

        public Colony()
        Constructor for objects of class Colony. Initializes the numberOfHouses to 0.

    • Method Detail

      • addHouse

        public boolean addHouse​(House house)
        Adds house to the colony if number of houses in the colony are less than 10.
        Parameters:
        house - The house to be added in the colony
        Returns:
        Returns true if house has been added successfully else return false. Note: Maximum houses in the colony cannot exceed 10.

      • getNumberOfHouses

        public int getNumberOfHouses()
        Returns the number of houses in the colony.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of houses in the colony.

      • goodWalls

        public int goodWalls()
        For each house in the colony, you need to find the total number of good walls in it and then return the sum of the number of good walls for every house. For example, if the colony has 2 houses and house1 has 10 good walls and house2 has 12 good walls, then you have to return 22.
        Returns:
        Returns the total number of good walls in each house of the colony

      • getRevenue

        public int getRevenue()
        In this method you have to calculate the revenue that is generated by the colony. So for each house in the colony, you need to find the revenue generated by that house and then take the sum of all of them and return it. For example, if there are 2 houses, and they generate 10 units and 20 units of revenue respectively, then you should return 30.
        Returns:
        Returns the sum of revenue generated by each house in the colony.
